name: Easy Indian Spiced Peas with Tomato sauce. Vegan Glutenfree Recipe
description: These Spiced Peas with cumin are easy and a great side that comes together in 10 minutes. Gluten-free Vegan Soy-free recipe
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup water or almond milk  (or other non dairy milk)

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, heat oil at medium heat and add garlic, if using. Cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, heat oil at medium heat and add garlic, if using. Cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cumin seeds and garam masala and cook for a few seconds until it starts to sizzle.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cumin seeds and garam masala and cook for a few seconds until it starts to sizzle.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the peas, garlic, 1/3 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp cayenne/chili powder and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the peas, garlic, 1/3 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp cayenne/chili powder and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and cook for 4 minutes and serve. :)
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and cook for 4 minutes and serve. :)

recipeInstructions.text: Or, Cover and cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Or, Cover and cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the tomato with water or almond milk for creamier curry and add to the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the tomato with water or almond milk for creamier curry and add to the pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Add a generous pinch of salt more and cook uncovered for 8-10 minutes or until the tomato sauce thickens.
recipeInstructions.name: Add a generous pinch of salt more and cook uncovered for 8-10 minutes or until the tomato sauce thickens.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot with Indian flat breads, pita, or rice. Add to a bowl with grains and greens, or add to tacos, wraps. Endless possibilities.
